"You better have your chores done if you are thinking about going out" says Stacy as Sara is tying her shoes. "And give Bryan back his Elmo doll that you hid last night. For the life of me, I don't know why you are always teasing him."

         "Its so much fun, mom, you should try it sometime" smirks Sara. Stacy fires a stern look at her daughter. "Jeez, I was just playing with him. I'll get the crybaby's toy from my room. And yes, I did all my chores. My room is clean, the garbage is out, the dishes are in the dishwasher, and I watered YOUR garden. All that for a measly 5 bucks a week. They taught us in school that Lincoln freed the slaves. I guess you didn't get the memo."

         "Watch your tongue, young lady" Stacy called out as Sara stomps off to her room. After slamming her door, Sara glances around her bedroom while trying to remember where she hid Elmo. She knows its not on her pink bed with her teddy bear collection. Its not on her bookshelf. That only hold the complete Harry Potter and Twilight series. She opens her dresser drawers but Elmo isn't hiding under her ripped jeans and thrift store blouses which highlight her lack of fashion sense.

         Lack of fashion sense? That's rich coming from a middle-aged slob who hasn't bought new cloths for himself for over 3 years. Just what are you trying to do here, Jacknife? Be descriptive? If you are then you're failing miserably. Your readers won't know what I'm really like just by telling them what books I read or that I collect stuffed animals. Come on, you haven't even told them what I look like, just that I am a tomboy. I can do a better job than you. As a matter of fact, I'll prove it.

         Readers, My name is Sara and I am 13 years old, 4'9", with long, curly brown hair blue-green eyes. My mom says that I'm too young to wear make-up, but I do have pink lip gloss on and my cheeks are covered in freckles. I am skinny but muscular, since I play a lot of sports. I have not developed much yet as a woman so all the pervs out there can stop reading now. My clothes may be from a thrift store, but I think that the light blue butterfly tank top and jewel studded blue jeans that I have on are really cute. I hope you are taking notes, Jack, because that's how you describe some one to your readers.

         Finally, she looks in her closet and finds Elmo behind her stinky roller blades. She grabs the doll and stalks out of her room and down the staircase. "Here's you stupid dolly, twerp" snarls Sara as she tosses Elmo to her 3 years old brother Bryan, who is sitting on the couch, watching Sesame Street.

"EWWW, Elmo smells badder den ma poopy diapee" cries Bryan as Sara walks toward the front door, past her mother. Stacy is on the phone and holds up a finger to tell her daughter to wait a second.

"Here she is right now, I'll let her know." says Stacy "Sara that was..."

“Well, I couldn’t throw away the present I got from my best friend. You might have given her to me back in Kindergarten, but she still means a lot to me” Tina replied.

Sara gazed down at Miss Starfly not sure of what she should say next. She barely remembered this cheap toy but clearly, Tina was still fond of her. Taking Miss Starfly from Tina, on one hand, Sara began scanning the room. She noticed Will leaning against the doorframe watching her and Tina and met his eyes. He said nothing but gestured to Sara's right where a plastic dollhouse and it's many residences lay scattered. She looked back at him with her face pleading for more help but Will only shrugged his shoulders. Tina's giddy smile and sparkling eyes silently raised the tension further. Sara was not ready for this.

Crawling over to the doll-house Sara, and quickly Tina in tow, sat down and soon both girls held dolls in each hand. Slowly the two of them started playing "house" together, with Sara trying her best to think of what exactly Mother Starfly would say and do in response to Baby Penelope's behavior. Tina's confidence combined with the positive energy she put into the Penelope character helped immensely with both girls' immersion.

Time flew by for the diapered teens, so much so that Sara hadn't noticed the plate of sandwiches (no crust and cut up into triangles) brought over by Will. What she did notice right away was Will's casual insertion of his finger into Tina's diaper!

Tina giggled and in a sing-song voice said. "No, I'm not. Daddy's is being silly."

Sara's eyes followed Tina as she was lead by the hand towards the changing mat. Will laid her down and pulled out one diaper from a store pack that wasn't there before. Sara shut her eyes and turned away just as Will was undoing the tapes. Her face grew beat red as Tina cooed and giggled during her personal change.

'Had these two started a relationship?' Sara thought to herself. 'You had to be dating to do something this intimate right?'

Sara sat very still as the scene between her two best friends played behind her.

"All done! You were such a good girl Tina."

"I'm always a good girl daddy!"

"Really now? So you've never been naughty?"

"Nuh huh"

"What about last week when you got into the baby-powder? I spent over an hour cleaning that up."

Tina was quiet, if she did respond then Sara couldn't hear it. What she could hear were footsteps coming back her way so she turned around to face her friends. Tina and Will stopped once they saw Sara's face. Their own expressions shifted to a look of concern.

"Sara, is something the matter?" Tina asked.

"Maybe we went a little too far with the role-play," Will said.

"I ah, ... well, are you ... I mean ..." Sara stuttered unable to complete a single thought much less a sentence.

"Listen, if you're uncomfortable with this,..." Will said.

"No, no. I mean, I am very weirded out by all of this and I didn't want to interrupt, but I couldn't help thinking..." Sara trailed off finding it hard to look her friends in the eye. The diapers and baby junk were bizarre in their own right but there was a far more pressing question she could barely choke out. Closing her eyes and taking a deep breath, Sara faced her worried friends.

"Tina. Will. Are you together? Like, boyfriend and girlfriend."

The two of them turned their eyes to the ground blushing bright red.

"I hoped you would love this as much as Will and I do. I wanted this baby play to be something we shared. I just wanted to be as much of myself around you as I am around Will."

"Oops, I guess I'm hungry..." Tina said awkwardly laughing. Kneeling down to the sandwiches she started wolfing them down as more of a distraction than anything.

"Look, Will, Tina, I love you both and obviously I want to stay friends. But this, all of this, is just too much too fast. I promise to keep an open mind about the diapers and the relationship. Just, promise me you both will ease me into this and not go overboard."

15.content:
"Your teacher Mr.Todd." says Stacy harshly "Do you know why he called me?"

         "To get your order for the bake sale?" replies Sara innocently. She keeps a straight face even though she knows that she's busted.

         "No, I wouldn't buy any cookies that you made since Home Ec. is one of the many classes that you are failing this semester" retorts Stacy. "Just how long did you think you'd get away with forging my name on all those failed tests you were suppose to bring home?" Sara starts to answer, but her mom interjects "That was a rhetorical question. You better clean up your act, young lady. Until you bring home passing grades you are hereby grounded. That means, no going out, no computer games, no Facebook or Myspace or Youtube, and no TV. And don't even think about sneaking in a show while I'm out because I'm going to parental block everything except the educational websites and TV programs and your brother's cartoons. Now go to your your an think about what you did."

         Just Great! No computer, no TV, no friends. All I can do is talk to a stupid Author wannabe. So what's the plan this time ,Jack? Bore me to death?

         It takes Stacy a half hour to set up all the blocks. When she is done, she announces that she needs to do some grocery shopping and takes Bryan with her. As soon as her mother is gone, Sara tries the television, but cannot break the code. The only show she can watch is Pokemon, which she hates. She then tries the computer, but can't log into her Facebook page. When she tries to go on Youtube, she finds that it is blocked too. However, two pop-ups appear on the screen. One is for a strange looking universal remote. The other is for a site call www.change-a-person.com. The website looks corny to Sara, but the only other thing she can think of doing is re-reading one of her books.

         So that's your plan. Whatever. I won't argue with you this time because anything is better than sitting here doing nothing.

info.description:
This is the tale of a 13 years old girl named Sar Castic.

         The name is Sara, you dweeb. Why is it that you Writers always take things so literally. Yeah, so what if my Mom forgot the second A on my birth certificate. EVERYONE calls me Sara and that includes you, Jacknife.

         Sara that's more like it is a bit of a tomboy and lives with her mother, Stacy and her brother, Bryan. She hangs out at the mall with her friends Will and Tina. She is just your average teenager until one day something strange happens.

         Oh My Gosh! Why does it have to be another transformation story. Is that all you people on writing.com know how to write these days? Just once I'd like to be in a romance, or a mystery, or even an old fashion fantasy with elves and dragons. So what are you going to do? Turn me into a boy? Regress me back into a baby? Make me fat? I play sports you know and this is going to seriously cramp my style. I bet you'll even steal other characters that REAL writers have made and turn this into a Fan-Fic. I hope you get bad reviews, Jacknife. So bad that even if you offer 500 GPs for a R&R no one will read this sorry piece of trash you call a story.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

         As you can see above, this is a story where the main character knows she is in a story and likes to talk back to the Author and Readers. This is the second story of this type that I have wrote. The first one was called Bill Igerant and while I deleted that one a year ago, I may rewrite it in the future. Now time for the rules(there are many so please bare with me).

1)The regular story is to be written in third person. Sara's words to the Author and Readers should be in first person and also be in Italics and Hot Pink. The interface for changing colors is much easier now than when I wrote Bill so I hope that everyone who adds will follow this format but I will edit and fix if someone has a problem.

2)I want strict adherence to the content rating. That means no sex, no swearing and no graphic violence. You can have a character be naked but no descriptions of gender specific body parts.

3) This story is made to poke fun at different genres that appear on writing.com, but only by those who love them. This is not meant for people to bash genres that they hate. So please only insult a type of story that you would normally write.

4)Here is a list of the genres that I want and do not want in here.
Approved genres: Shrinking, growing, age regression/progression,adult baby, tickling,fart torture, inflating, fattening, gender bending, animal transformation(full and anthro),fanfic, fantasy, mythology,magic items, wishing.
Restricted genres:Vore, unbirthing, gay/lesbian, scat.
Anything else that isn't on either list is allowed as long as it doesn't conflict with the content rating.

5)Sara loves to insult whoever is writing about her. Be inventive about it as long as it is PG13. However, she will only insult the current author of a chapter. That means that when you add a chapter, the only author you can have her insult is you. The exception to this rule is me. Anyone can have her insult me. Don't worry, I am thick skinned.

6) Please write at least 2 paragraphs with each addition. I don't want any choice chapters. The exception will be when I write a choice chapter and then have Sara berate me for it for 2 paragraphs.

7)Have fun with it. This is meant to be lighthearted and silly, so I hope you get as much enjoyment out of this as I do.
